BOOK COVER

2nd Place Ribbon Winner in a regional jury competition San Diego County Fair under the category of Computer Graphics


The name of this fictitious book is “1001 California sunset”. It is a reference to the famous ancient Arabic book – “The Book of One Thousand and One Nights”. In that book, Scheherazade, the wife of the king tells his husband a new story every night for 1001 nights as she is trying to save herself from execution. From this reference, the number 1001 is used as a generic term for a very large number. All the sunsets we are witnessing every night are completely different. Every sunset is like a profound story. Some of them are dramatic, some others are fun and playful. The sun goes away every night but the beauty of the sunset gives us hope that it will get backs tomorrow with a new tale… like Scheherazade comes up with a new story every night with the hope to postpone her execution…



The whole artwork was created in Adobe Photoshop. All in all, I used seven photos in different arrangements. Five of them are photos of sunsets and two are photos of photographer’s figures. Even though the title of the book came as a reference of the ancient Arabic book, this is not a fictional book but a photography guide. This book is meant to be a guide for photographers with different techniques on how to make a perfect sunset photo and also how to edit it later with a program like Photoshop. That’s why on the book cover you would see two images of photographers trying to shoot the perfect sunset photo. The work is done in warm colors because the main goal was to present a cozy mood of the sunset.
